net.jxta.content
Interface ContentTransferAggregator

All Superinterfaces:
ContentTransfer
All Known Implementing Classes:
TransferAggregator
public interface ContentTransferAggregator
extends ContentTransfer

This interface represents a content transfer which is acting as a front for multiple ContentTransfer instances, all of which are working to obtain a single Content instance. This allows ContentService implementations to provide failover mechanisms and provider randomization while maintaining operational transparency to the end user.

An explicit effort was made to always expose the actual ContentTransfer instances to the end-user. This interface provides a mechanism by which to accomplish this design goal.

See Also:
ContentTransfer, ContentProvider, ContentService

addContentTransferAggregatorListener

void addContentTransferAggregatorListener(ContentTransferAggregatorListener listener)
Adds an event listener to track the operation and progress of the transfer.

Parameters:
listener - listener instance to add

removeContentTransferAggregatorListener

void removeContentTransferAggregatorListener(ContentTransferAggregatorListener listener)
Removes a previously registered event listener.

Parameters:
listener - listener instance to remove

getCurrentContentTransfer

ContentTransfer getCurrentContentTransfer()
Returns the currently selected/active ContentTransfer instance being actively used to retrieve the Content. Note that many instances may be actively seeking peers that have the requested Content (at the aggregator's discretion), but only the instance actively downloading from a remote peer will be returned by this method.

Returns:
current ContentTransfer instance, or null if no instance is currently retrieving data

getContentTransferList

List<ContentTransfer> getContentTransferList()
Returns the current list ContentTransfer instances being managed by the aggregated transfer object.

Returns:
list of ContentTransfer instances
